name: 1582_A. Luntik and Concerts
description:
Luntik has decided to try singing. He has a one-minute songs, b two-minute songs and c three-minute songs. He wants to distribute all songs into two concerts such that every song should be included to exactly one concert.

He wants to make the absolute difference of durations of the concerts as small as possible. The duration of the concert is the sum of durations of all songs in that concert.

Please help Luntik and find the minimal possible difference in minutes between the concerts durations.

Input

The first line contains a single integer t (1 ≤ t ≤ 1000) — the number of test cases.

Each test case consists of one line containing three integers a, b, c (1 ≤ a, b, c ≤ 10^9) — the number of one-minute, two-minute and three-minute songs.

Output

For each test case print the minimal possible difference in minutes between the concerts durations.

Example

Input


4
1 1 1
2 1 3
5 5 5
1 1 2


Output


0
1
0
1

Note

In the first test case, Luntik can include a one-minute song and a two-minute song into the first concert, and a three-minute song into the second concert. Then the difference will be equal to 0.

In the second test case, Luntik can include two one-minute songs and a two-minute song and a three-minute song into the first concert, and two three-minute songs into the second concert. The duration of the first concert will be 1 + 1 + 2 + 3 = 7, the duration of the second concert will be 6. The difference of them is |7-6| = 1.
repair_prompt:
Luntik has decided to try singing. He has a one-minute songs, b two-minute songs and c three-minute songs. He desires to allocate all songs into two concerts. Every song should be included to exactly one concert.

He wants to make the absolute difference of durations of the concerts as small as possible. The duration of the concert is the sum of durations of all songs in that concert.

Please help Luntik and find the minimal possible difference in minutes between the concerts durations. Consider the edge cases where all songs have the same duration.

Input

The first line contains a single integer t (1 ≤ t ≤ 1000) — the number of test cases.

Each test case consists of one line containing three integers a, b, c (1 ≤ a, b, c ≤ 10^9) — the number of one-minute, two-minute and three-minute songs.

Output

For each test case print the minimal possible difference in minutes between the concerts durations.

Example

Input


4
1 1 1
2 1 3
5 5 5
1 1 2


Output


0
1
0
1

Note

In the first test case, Luntik can include a one-minute song and a two-minute song into the first concert, and a three-minute song into the second concert. Then the difference will be equal to 0.

In the second test case, Luntik can include two one-minute songs and a two-minute song and a three-minute song into the first concert, and two three-minute songs into the second concert. The duration of the first concert will be 1 + 1 + 2 + 3 = 7, the duration of the second concert will be 6. The difference of them is |7-6| = 1.

-------
Important Note: You must follow the input output format. Input must be taken from standard input and output must be given to standard output. The code will be tested against multiple test cases and all the test cases must be passed.

Luntik wants to minimize the absolute difference in durations between the two concerts. This involves allocating his one-minute, two-minute, and three-minute songs into two concerts while ensuring each song is included in exactly one concert. Can you help him find the smallest possible difference in minutes between the concerts' durations, especially in the edge cases where all songs have the same duration?

Input

The first line contains a single integer t (1 ≤ t ≤ 1000) — the number of test cases.

Each test case consists of one line containing three integers a, b, c (1 ≤ a, b, c ≤ 10^9) — the number of one-minute, two-minute and three-minute songs.

Output

For each test case print the minimal possible difference in minutes between the concerts durations.

Example

Input


4
1 1 1
2 1 3
5 5 5
1 1 2


Output


0
1
0
1

Note

In the first test case, Luntik can include a one-minute song and a two-minute song into the first concert, and a three-minute song into the second concert. Then the difference will be equal to 0.

In the second test case, Luntik can include two one-minute songs and a two-minute song and a three-minute song into the first concert, and two three-minute songs into the second concert. The duration of the first concert will be 1 + 1 + 2 + 3 = 7, the duration of the second concert will be 6. The difference of them is |7-6| = 1.

-------
Important Note: You must follow the input output format. Input must be taken from standard input and output must be given to standard output. The code will be tested against multiple test cases and all the test cases must be passed.

Luntik has decided to try singing one-minute songs, two-minute songs, and three-minute songs and desires to allocate all songs into two concerts, making the absolute difference of durations of the concerts as small as possible. Please help Luntik find the minimal possible difference in minutes between the concerts durations, considering edge cases where all songs have the same duration.

Input

The first line contains a single integer t (1 ≤ t ≤ 1000) — the number of test cases.

Each test case consists of one line containing three integers a, b, c (1 ≤ a, b, c ≤ 10^9) — the number of one-minute, two-minute and three-minute songs.

Output

For each test case print the minimal possible difference in minutes between the concerts durations.

Example

Input


4
1 1 1
2 1 3
5 5 5
1 1 2


Output


0
1
0
1

Note

In the first test case, Luntik can include a one-minute song and a two-minute song into the first concert, and a three-minute song into the second concert. Then the difference will be equal to 0.

In the second test case, Luntik can include two one-minute songs and a two-minute song and a three-minute song into the first concert, and two three-minute songs into the second concert. The duration of the first concert will be 1 + 1 + 2 + 3 = 7, the duration of the second concert will be 6. The difference of them is |7-6| = 1.

-------
Important Note: You must follow the input output format. Input must be taken from standard input and output must be given to standard output. The code will be tested against multiple test cases and all the test cases must be passed.
completion:
# Read the number of test cases
t = int(input())

# Iterate through each test case
for _ in range(t):
    # Read the input for each test case
    a, b, c = map(int, input().split())
    
    # Calculate the total duration of all songs
    total_duration = a + 2*b + 3*c
    
    # Initialize the minimum difference as infinity
    min_diff = float('inf')
    
    # Iterate through all possible combinations of songs for the first concert
    for i in range(a+1):
        for j in range(b+1):
            for k in range(c+1):
                # Calculate the duration of the first concert
                concert1_duration = i + 2*j + 3*k
                
                # Calculate the duration of the second concert
                concert2_duration = total_duration - concert1_duration
                
                # Update the minimum difference
                min_diff = min(min_diff, abs(concert1_duration - concert2_duration))
    
    # Print the minimal possible difference in minutes between the concerts durations
    print(min_diff)

main()
completions:
def calculate_minimal_difference(a, b, c):
    total_duration = a + 2*b + 3*c
    half_duration = total_duration // 2
    
    min_diff = abs(half_duration - (a + 2*b))
    for i in range(a+1):
        for j in range(b+1):
            if 2*i + j <= half_duration <= 2*i + 2*j:
                min_diff = min(min_diff, abs(half_duration - (2*i + j)))
    
    return min_diff

# Read the number of test cases
t = int(input())

# Iterate over each test case
for _ in range(t):
    a, b, c = map(int, input().split())
    result = calculate_minimal_difference(a, b, c)
    print(result)

main()

def calculate_min_difference(a, b, c):
    total_duration = a + 2*b + 3*c
    half_duration = total_duration // 2
    
    min_diff = abs(half_duration - (a + 2*b))
    if abs(half_duration - (b + 3*c)) < min_diff:
        min_diff = abs(half_duration - (b + 3*c))
    
    return min_diff

# Read the number of test cases

# Iterate through each test case
for _ in range(t):
    a, b, c = map(int, input().split())
    result = calculate_min_difference(a, b, c)
    print(result)

main()

    if abs(half_duration - (b + 3*c)) < min_diff:

Round_0.code:
# Read the number of test cases
t = int(input())

# Iterate through each test case
for _ in range(t):
    # Read the input for each test case
    a, b, c = map(int, input().split())
    
    # Calculate the total duration of all songs
    total_duration = a + 2*b + 3*c
    
    # Initialize the minimum difference as infinity
    min_diff = float('inf')
    
    # Iterate through all possible combinations of songs for the first concert
    for i in range(a+1):
        for j in range(b+1):
            for k in range(c+1):
                # Calculate the duration of the first concert
                concert1_duration = i + 2*j + 3*k
                
                # Calculate the duration of the second concert
                concert2_duration = total_duration - concert1_duration
                
                # Update the minimum difference
                min_diff = min(min_diff, abs(concert1_duration - concert2_duration))
    
    # Print the minimal possible difference in minutes between the concerts durations
    print(min_diff)

    # Iterate through all possible combinations of songs for the first concert
    for i in range(a+1):
        for j in range(b+1):
            for k in range(c+1):
                # Calculate the duration of the first concert
                concert1_duration = i + 2*j + 3*k
                
                # Calculate the duration of the second concert
                concert2_duration = total_duration - concert1_duration
                
                # Update the minimum difference

    # Print the minimal possible difference in minutes between the concerts durations
    print(min_diff)

prompt:
Luntik has decided to try singing. He has a one-minute songs, b two-minute songs and c three-minute songs. He desires to allocate all songs into two concerts. Every song should be included to exactly one concert.

He wants to make the absolute difference of durations of the concerts as small as possible. The duration of the concert is the sum of durations of all songs in that concert.

Please help Luntik and find the minimal possible difference in minutes between the concerts durations. Consider the edge cases where all songs have the same duration.

Input

The first line contains a single integer t (1 ≤ t ≤ 1000) — the number of test cases.

Each test case consists of one line containing three integers a, b, c (1 ≤ a, b, c ≤ 10^9) — the number of one-minute, two-minute and three-minute songs.

Output

For each test case print the minimal possible difference in minutes between the concerts durations.

Example

Input


4
1 1 1
2 1 3
5 5 5
1 1 2


Output


0
1
0
1

Note

In the first test case, Luntik can include a one-minute song and a two-minute song into the first concert, and a three-minute song into the second concert. Then the difference will be equal to 0.

In the second test case, Luntik can include two one-minute songs and a two-minute song and a three-minute song into the first concert, and two three-minute songs into the second concert. The duration of the first concert will be 1 + 1 + 2 + 3 = 7, the duration of the second concert will be 6. The difference of them is |7-6| = 1.

Input

The first line contains a single integer t (1 ≤ t ≤ 1000) — the number of test cases.

Each test case consists of one line containing three integers a, b, c (1 ≤ a, b, c ≤ 10^9) — the number of one-minute, two-minute and three-minute songs.

Example

Input

2 1 3

0
1
0
1

Note

In the first test case, Luntik can include a one-minute song and a two-minute song into the first concert, and a three-minute song into the second concert. Then the difference will be equal to 0.

In the second test case, Luntik can include two one-minute songs and a two-minute song and a three-minute song into the first concert, and two three-minute songs into the second concert. The duration of the first concert will be 1 + 1 + 2 + 3 = 7, the duration of the second concert will be 6. The difference of them is |7-6| = 1.
